Mexican mayor assassinated during Day of the Dead celebrations
subhead: Carlos Alberto Manzo Rodríguez, the mayor of the Uruapan municipality in the country's western state of Michoacan, was shot dead in the town's plaza in front of a large crowd gathered for Day of the Dead festivities. The attacker was killed at the scene.

title: 'I never eat alone anymore': La Cop1ne, a Parisian community canteen offering a cure for loneliness
subhead: In Paris, the first solidarity canteen run by the Cop1 association opened its doors a year ago. Its mission: to combat food insecurity and social isolation among students.

title: At the Musée Picasso, Philip Guston and the irony of history
subhead: The American painter, a major figure of the second half of the 20th century who moved from figurative art to abstract expressionism, blended biting irony with a critique of American society.

title: 'Airbnb is easy money and it's highly addictive': Thousands of French turn their homes into hotels
subhead: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (5/6). Over the past decade, a whole economy has developed around short-term rentals, a rapidly growing market in France. Property owners readily call on concierge companies or specialists in listing and price optimization.
byline: By Véronique Chocron (Nice, Versailles (France), special correspondent)

title: China uses subsidies, coercion and propaganda to boost falling birth rates
subhead: After zealously enforcing the one-child policy, the city of Tianmen has made boosting the birth rate a top priority, as fertility continues to decline across China.

title: French lesbian literature steps into the spotlight with new prize
subhead: The Prix Gouincourt will be awarded for the first time next Friday, a few days after its illustrious model, the Prix Goncourt. It aims to highlight a genre that is becoming increasingly prominent.

title: All-you-can-eat buffets attract gourmet and value-conscious diners in France's city centers
subhead: Once mainly found near shopping centers, restaurants offering all-you-can-eat buffets, a model focusing on conviviality, comfort and an abundance of food, have started to open in Paris, Lyon and Bordeaux.
